channel.title: Profiling?
channel.description: Nexus S 4G running GummyNex 1.0.2 with default air kernel... I have a few questions. I'm trying to save battery life as much as possible, and currently I have two configurations, one for pure battery life, the other for performance: 1: Battery Saving - Different launcher w/o widgets, simple usage, generally have mobile data off but sometimes on, 100 mhz min 400 mhz max, wheatley governor 2: Power Usage - Apex, 1400 mhz max 100 min, smartassV2 Is there a way to let me switch this automatically? I know if I were to use setcpu instead of the built in performance I could switch like that, but I'm more interested in a way to change the default launcher based on the profile.

item.title: Profiling?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:2, topic:440441”]So, similar to Smart Actions for the RAZR?

Tasker is supposed to be a great alternative, but it does have a steep learning curve… There are cheaper/free alternatives, but I haven’t heard much about them Locale, AutomateIt, etc[/quote]
HMM, i haven’t had a chance to try out smart actions
i looked into tasker briefly last night, i’m not sure if that can achieve what i want, but i’ll probably try it out after exams, or maybe one of those alternatives, thanks!
right now i’m thinking i don’t really care about the launcher side though, as that does seem to be impossible to automate

Read full topic

item.title: Profiling?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Nexus S 4G running GummyNex 1.0.2 with default air kernel… I have a few questions.
I’m trying to save battery life as much as possible, and currently I have two configurations, one for pure battery life, the other for performance:
1: Battery Saving - Different launcher w/o widgets, simple usage, generally have mobile data off but sometimes on, 100 mhz min 400 mhz max, wheatley governor
2: Power Usage - Apex, 1400 mhz max 100 min, smartassV2
Is there a way to let me switch this automatically? I know if I were to use setcpu instead of the built in performance I could switch like that, but I’m more interested in a way to change the default launcher based on the profile.

Read full topic
